dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?
News Content: If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now?

Benzinga and Yahoo Finance LLC may earn commission or revenue on some items through the links below.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), the largest company in the world with a $3.52 trillion market capitalization, designs, manufactures and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables and accessories worldwide.

It is set to report its Q1 2025 earnings on January 30. Wall Street analysts expect the tech giant to post an EPS of $2.35, up from $2.18 in the year-ago period. According to Benzinga Pro, quarterly revenue is expected to reach $124.40 billion, up from $119.58 billion in the previous year.

Don't Miss:

Unlock the hidden potential of commercial real estate — This platform allows individuals to invest in commercial real estate offering a 12% target yield with a bonus 1% return boost today! Maker of the $60,000 foldable home has 3 factory buildings, 600+ houses built, and big plans to solve housing — you can become an investor for $0.80 per share today.

If You Bought Apple Stock 10 Years Ago

The company's stock traded at approximately $27.45 per share 10 years ago. If you had invested $10,000, you could have bought roughly 364 shares. Currently, shares trade at $234.40, meaning your investment's value could have grown to $85,392 from stock price appreciation alone. However, Apple also paid dividends during these 10 years.

Apple's dividend yield is currently 0.43%. Over the last 10 years, it has paid about $18.91 in dividends per share, which means you could have made $6,889 from dividends alone.

Summing up $85,392 and $6,889, we end up with the final value of your investment, which is $92,281. This is how much you could have made if you had invested $10,000 in Apple stock 10 years ago. This means a total return of 822.81%. In comparison, S&P 500 total return for the same period is 228.10%.

See Also: If there was a new fund backed by Jeff Bezos offering a 7-9% target yield with monthly dividends would you invest in it?

What Could The Next 10 Years Bring?

Apple has a consensus rating of "Buy" and a price target of $245.17 based on the ratings of 30 analysts. The price target implies more than a 4% upside from the current stock price.

On Oct. 31, 2024, the company announced its Q4 2024 earnings, posting revenues of $94.9 billion, beating analyst estimates of $94.56 billion, as reported by Benzinga.

The iPhone maker reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.64 per share, beating analyst estimates of $1.60 per share. Total revenue was up 6% year over year. Products revenue came in at $69.96 billion, up from $67.18 billion year over year. Services revenue totaled $24.97 billion, up from $22.31 billion year over year.

Story Continues

Trending: Commercial real estate has historically outperformed the stock market, and this platform allows individuals to invest in commercial real estate with as little as $5,000 offering a 12% target yield with a bonus 1% return boost today!

Check out this article by Benzinga, which delves into an extensive industry comparison, evaluating Apple compared to its major competitors within the Technology Hardware, Storage and peripherals industry.

Given just 4% expected upside potential, growth-focused investors may not find Apple stock attractive. Furthermore, the stock won't likely appeal to income-focused investors as it offers a modest dividend yield of 0.43%.

Wondering if your investments can get you to a $5,000,000 nest egg? Speak to a financial advisor today. SmartAsset’s free tool matches you up with up to three vetted financial advisors who serve your area, and you can interview your advisor matches at no cost to decide which one is right for you.

A 9% Return In Just 3 Months

EquityMultiple's ‘Alpine Note — Basecamp Series' is turning heads and opening wallets. This short-term note investment offers investors a 9% rate of return (APY) with just a 3 month term and $5K minimum. The Basecamp rate is at a significant spread to t-bills. This healthy rate of return won't last long. With the Fed poised to cut interest rates in the near future, now could be the time to lock in a favorable rate of return with a flexible, relatively liquid investment option.

What's more, Alpine Note — Basecamp can be rolled into another Alpine Note for compounding returns, or into another of EquityMultiple's rigorously vetted real estate investments, which also carry a minimum investment of just $5K. Basecamp is exclusively open to new investors on the EquityMultiple platform.

Looking for fractional real estate investment opportunities? The Benzinga Real Estate Screener features the latest offerings.

This article If You Invested $10,000 In Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, How Much Would You Have Now? originally appeared on Benzinga.com

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news about the potential ban of TikTok may lead to a redistribution of its users and advertising revenue among competitors like Instagram, YouTube, and Snapchat. This could result in a decrease in user engagement for platforms associated with Apple, specifically if TikTok is removed from the App Store. Additionally, uncertainties about legal risks for Apple could create negative sentiment among investors, which may result in a higher probability of stock price decline. However, the extent of this impact on Apple's overall business model remains uncertain.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The article primarily focuses on Apple's historical performance and potential future growth. While the historical performance is impressive, it's already reflected in the current stock price. The forward-looking information is mixed. Analysts predict a 4% upside, which is mildly positive. The article also points out potential downsides, such as the modest dividend yield and that it might not be attractive to growth-focused investors. Q1 2025 earnings are expected to be positive, but this is already factored in by analysts - if Apple reports Q1 earnings results lower than expected there will be a significant stock price drop. Overall, the article presents a balanced view, suggesting that the news is neither strongly bullish nor strongly bearish. Therefore, stock price will be neutral (0.4) to positive (0.6).
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on Nvidia's new AI safety tools and its CEO's absence from Trump's inauguration.  While Nvidia's advancements are positive, the article's relevance to Apple is minimal.  The mention of Apple CEO Tim Cook attending the inauguration is purely contextual and doesn't suggest any direct impact on Apple's stock price.  Therefore, the news is unlikely to significantly affect Apple's stock price, either positively or negatively. Any price movement would likely be due to other market factors unrelated to this news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The Supreme Court's decision to uphold the US ban on TikTok unless it is sold to a non-foreign adversary owner could have mixed implications for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, the ban could reduce the number of apps available on the App Store, potentially affecting Apple's services revenue. On the other hand, the ban could benefit Apple's competitors in the social media space, such as Meta (META), which might see increased advertising revenue. However, Apple's core business is not directly tied to TikTok's operations, and the overall impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be neutral to slightly positive, given the potential for increased advertising spend on other platforms that may benefit Apple indirectly. The uncertainty around Trump's potential executive order and the legal complexities add some risk, but it is not expected to significantly impact Apple's stock.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The provided news article discusses the Q3 earnings of various consumer electronics stocks, including Peloton (PTON), GoPro (GPRO), Apple (AAPL), and Sonos (SONO). The article highlights that Apple's Q3 earnings were satisfactory, with revenues up 6.1% year on year, exceeding analysts' expectations by 0.5%. Despite this positive performance, the stock price reaction is relatively muted, with Apple's stock up only 1.7% since the earnings report. Considering the overall positive earnings report and the general trend of the stock market, which has been thriving in 2024, it seems that the market has already priced in the satisfactory performance. However, the uncertainty about the outlook for 2025, including potential changes in trade policy and corporate taxes, might cap the upside potential. Given these factors, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising and a lower probability of it falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news about Apple pausing its AI-generated news alerts due to inaccuracy issues may have a minor negative impact on the company's stock price. The issue is related to a specific feature and does not appear to be a major concern for the company's overall financial performance or long-term strategy. However, the fact that Apple is taking steps to address the issue and improve the feature may be seen as a positive sign of the company's commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Given the relatively minor nature of the issue and the company's quick response to address it, the probability of a significant stock price movement is low.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's past performance and future expectations. The company's historical success and strong expected earnings have led to a positive analyst outlook. Despite the modest dividend yield and limited expected upside potential, the overall context suggests a stable and potentially growing stock. The news does not introduce any negative factors that would likely cause a stock price fall but does highlight a limited upside potential.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The ruling against TikTok poses potential challenges for Apple due to legal risks surrounding the app's presence in the App Store, which could lead to reduced user engagement on the platform if users migrate to competitors like Instagram and YouTube. This shift might negatively impact Apple's services revenue and create a cautious sentiment among investors, leading to an increased probability of a stock price decline. Moreover, while other competitors may benefit from TikTok's audience and revenue redistribution, the immediate implications for Apple regarding its app ecosystem and legal uncertainties dilute any potential positive outlook. Therefore, the estimated probabilities suggest a higher likelihood of stock price falling compared to rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article focuses on Apple's impressive historical performance and expected Q1 2025 earnings. The historical data showing substantial returns over the past 10 years paints a positive picture, potentially attracting investors. The expected earnings growth for Q1 2025 (EPS of $2.35, up from $2.18 year-over-year, and revenue expected to reach $124.40 billion, up from $119.58 billion) reinforces a positive outlook. However, the article also mentions a modest dividend yield and an analyst price target suggesting only a 4% upside, which could limit the enthusiasm of growth or dividend-focused investors. Given the positive earnings expectations and the article's overall tone, the probability of a price increase is slightly elevated. The prior turns have more neutral stances. After considering the previous rounds of predictions and taking on board that I have no unique information, the previous high and low average each other out.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Nvidia's AI safety tools and its CEO's absence from the Trump inauguration.  This news is largely irrelevant to Apple. The only connection is the mention of Apple CEO Tim Cook attending the inauguration, which is purely contextual and unlikely to impact Apple's stock price.  Previous predictions show a range of views, with some suggesting a slightly higher probability of a price rise and others closer to neutral. Given the lack of direct relevance to Apple, the most likely scenario is that the news will have minimal impact on Apple's stock price. Any movement would likely be due to broader market factors or other news unrelated to this article.  The previous predictions' variance highlights the difficulty of predicting stock price movements based on limited, indirect news, reinforcing a neutral stance.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The Supreme Court's decision to uphold the US ban on TikTok unless it is sold to a non-foreign adversary owner has mixed implications for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On the negative side, the ban could reduce the number of apps available on the App Store, potentially affecting Apple's services revenue. Additionally, there are legal uncertainties for Apple if it is required to enforce the ban, which could create negative investor sentiment. On the positive side, the ban could benefit Apple's competitors in the social media space, such as Meta (META), which might see increased advertising revenue, indirectly benefiting Apple. However, Apple's core business is not directly tied to TikTok's operations, and the overall impact is likely to be neutral to slightly negative. The uncertainty around Trump's potential executive order and the legal complexities add some risk, but it is not expected to significantly impact Apple's stock.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The provided news article discusses the Q3 earnings of various consumer electronics stocks, including Apple (AAPL). Apple's Q3 earnings were satisfactory, with revenues up 6.1% year on year, exceeding analysts' expectations by 0.5%. The stock price reaction is relatively muted, with Apple's stock up only 1.7% since the earnings report. Considering the overall positive earnings report and the general trend of the stock market, which has been thriving in 2024, it seems that the market has already priced in the satisfactory performance. However, the uncertainty about the outlook for 2025, including potential changes in trade policy and corporate taxes, might cap the upside potential. Given these factors, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising and a lower probability of it falling.

Considering the relatively minor nature of the issue and the company's quick response, the probability of a significant stock price movement is low. The previous predictions from other models show a trend of neutral to slightly positive expectations for Apple's stock price. Given this context, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising and a lower probability of it falling.

While Apple's expected earnings and current stock valuation suggest a stable market position, the modest dividend yield and limited potential upside suggest caution. Moreover, some past predictions point towards uncertainty in stock price movements due to mixed implications. However, recent earnings and analyst ratings suggest a moderately positive outlook, offsetting the cautious sentiments. Considering all these factors, the stock has a moderate chance of slight growth.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The recent ruling regarding the potential ban on TikTok brings uncertainty to Apple due to possible legal risks and implications for user engagement, as TikTok's audience may migrate to competitors like Instagram and YouTube, potentially impacting Apple's services revenue negatively. The analysis of previous predictions indicates a more cautious sentiment among analysts, with concerns over legal liabilities and competition affecting the mood around Apple's stock. However, some predictions suggest that despite these challenges, the impact on Apple's core business might be neutral to slightly positive. Balancing these factors, I estimate a slightly higher probability of stock price falling than rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The article focuses on Apple's impressive historical performance and projects continued growth, as indicated by the expected Q1 2025 earnings report. While the highlighted past performance is substantial, it may already be factored into the current stock price. Analysts' consensus suggests a 'Buy' rating and a 4% upside, which is modestly positive but might not excite growth-oriented investors. The modest dividend yield further limits appeal to income investors. Considering these factors, the positive earnings expectations for Q1 2025, and acknowledging that previous predictions are mixed, I anticipate a slightly positive outlook. The previous rounds have a range of predictions, so I will weigh them in my estimate.

This is largely irrelevant to Apple. The only tangential connection is the mention of Apple CEO Tim Cook attending the inauguration, which is highly unlikely to influence Apple's stock price.  The previous predictions show a wide range of probabilities, from a slight likelihood of a price increase to a neutral stance. Given the lack of direct relevance to Apple, the news is unlikely to have a significant impact on its stock price.  Any movement would likely be driven by broader market trends or other news unrelated to the article.  Considering the lack of direct impact and the inconsistent predictions in previous rounds, I assign near-equal probabilities to a price rise and a price fall.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The Supreme Court's decision to uphold the US ban on TikTok has mixed implications for Apple Inc. Q1 2025 earnings are expected to be positive but factored into expectations, so better results might create a boost. The previous turn's range from TikTok ban concerns to neutral based on irrelevant news. I previously predicted it to be equal but now it seems that it is neutral to slightly positive outlook for Apple's stock price. However, the previous turns had a slight upward trend.
